intro: Glossarrhen parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered glossarrhen, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or brown, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Glossarrhen parviflorus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
